title: Land of the rising space startups

title: POLARIS Spaceplanes Takes Delivery of MIRA II and III Airframes
summary: Bremen-based startup POLARIS Spaceplanes has taken delivery of a pair of airframe structures for its MIRA II and MIRA III spaceplane demonstrators. MIRA II and III will be identical five-metre-long spaceplane demonstrators powered by four turbine jet engines and one of the company’s in-house-developed AS-1 linear aerospike rocket engines. The pair will replace the decommissioned […]

title: NASA proceeding with August launch of Crew-9
summary: NASA is pressing ahead with a mid-August launch of the next Crew Dragon mission while delaying the first operational flight of Starliner.

title: ULA’s Atlas 5 launches its final national security mission
summary: The rocket lifted off July 30 at 6:45 a.m. Eastern from Space Launch Complex-41 at Cape Canaveral Air Force Station in Florida.

title: Rolls-Royce Submarines to Develop Nuclear Reactors for UK Space Agency
summary: Rolls-Royce Submarines has received £4.8 million in additional UK Space Agency funding to develop a Space Micro-Reactor demonstrator. The funding was announced as part of £33 million in UK Space Agency (UKSA) awards, supporting the continued development of more than 20 national space projects. This funding comes from the agency’s National Space Innovation Programme, which […]

title: NISAR launch slips to 2025
summary: The launch of a joint U.S.-Indian radar imaging satellite will not take place before February 2025 because of work on the spacecraft’s antenna and orbital constraints, NASA said July 29.

title: Starliner Passes In-Orbit Tests, But First Operational Launch Slips

title: Announcing the launch of Starris: Optimax Space Systems,  lifting precision optical payloads from idea to orbit in one year
summary: Agile, space-qualified optical payloads enable customers to enter booming space economy quickly with low risk. Ontario, N.Y. — The commercialization of space is creating unprecedented opportunities for the space economy. […]
